column4: does anyone know how to force apt re-downloading a package which seems to be correct downloaded/installed and in the latest version and so on?
which package, what version of ubuntu; paste.ubuntu.com with the errors when you try to remove it
karmic?
what version of ubuntu and paste.ubuntu.com with the errors
hold on
why would you possibly try to remove wget
it remains unconfigured and messes up my package-database

please paste.ubuntu.com with your sources.list
hold on
http://paste.ubuntu.com/290725/
what is the final repo? le-web.org and why are you using root and dpkg to remove packages and not apt-get with sudo
i have been using linux for years, and I am used to a root-account avaiable. It is a mess when a user can commit admin-tasks with his own pw.
how old is this install
what do you mean? This is up-to-date, and this install is half a year afair
when did this wget issue surface? that is an important package and worrisome that you would need to reinstall it
any recollection of what led to it? aha
sorry, I dont remember.
not completely installed
